topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade (Beta): Live Migrate an Instance

body.p: Users can live migrate an instance as needed.

Migration enables an administrator to move a virtual-machine instance from one compute host to another. This feature is useful when a compute host requires maintenance. Migration can also be useful to redistribute the load when many VM instances are running on a specific physical machine.
Live migration requires almost no downtime and is useful when the instances must be kept running during the migration. For more information, see Live Migration of Virtual Machines.
If you do not need to live migrate an instance, you can cold migrate the instance instead.

section.title: Migrate an instance on an hLinux server
section.p: Instances on hLinux servers can be migrated to another instance as follows.

li.p: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack(R) Horizon Dashboard.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Instances link.
In the Instances screen, for the instance you want to migrate, click the arrow icon in the Actions menu and select Migrate Instance.
In the Instances screen, for the instance you want to migrate, click the arrow icon in the Actions menu and select Live Migrate Instance.

Specify the target compute node for the migration. The default value is to auto-schedule the virtual machine following the current scheduling guidelines and constraints. Optionally, you can manually select the target compute node.
Note that the set of available target compute nodes for the migration is still subject to the scheduler constraints from the virtual machine flavor and other systems options that might be in place.
Select Disk Over Commit to use the Overcommit feature.

Select Block Migration to use the KVM live block migration feature where the instance is migrated over TCP and no local storage is required.

section.title: Migrate an instance on a Wind River Linux server
section.p: Instances on Wind River Linux servers can be migrated to a specific instance.

li.p: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack(R) Horizon Dashboard.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Instances link.
In the Instances screen, for the instance you want to migrate, click the arrow icon in the Actions menu and select Live Migrate Instance.

Specify the target compute node for the migration. The default value is to auto-schedule the virtual machine following the current scheduling guidelines and constraints. Optionally, you can manually select the target compute node.
Note that the set of available target compute nodes for the migration is still subject to the scheduler constraints from the virtual machine flavor and other systems options that might be in place.
